reviews.review:
From throwing baseballs at an interracial couple to mowing down innocent unarmed bystanders in unprompted bouts of psychosis, this game gives a harrowing look at one's own sick sense of humor and lack of self control when given an assortment of guns and the power to fire them indiscriminately into crowded public venues.

A delightful experience overall, but you aren't able to shoot the children, so I can only give it a 7 out of 10.

Jogo muito bom, ótima história, jogabilidade, gráficos (mesmo na mais baixa das configurações gráficas), IA e principalmente a Elizabeth, além de ser uma ótima personagem, tanto em beleza quanto em carisma, se mostra extremamente útil nas batalhas e não interfere em nada. Valeu cada centavo, tanto o jogo, quanto suas DLC que adicionam ainda 4 horas de jogatina e de história para a trilogia Bioshock.

si direi che anche io mi unisco a quelli ke hanno trovato il gioco bello .. bello se lo hai pagato 7 euro con gli sconti steam .. a prezzo pieno mi sarei un po' dispiaciuto. La storia è interessante con vari colpi di scena. il finale è inaspettato. mi spiace per la rigiocabilità ke mi sembra quasi nulla e con il fatto che il gioco duri al massimo 12 ore è un peccato .. avrebbero dovuto mettere piu fasi di combattimento per dare la possibilita di usare un po di piu le abilità acqusite e sparare qualche colpo in piu .. in definitiva BUONO SE COMPERATO A 7 EURO ... Bioschock Infinite is my favourite single player game so far.The breathtakingly emotional plot is embedded with many small, noticeable framework tales; in depth, yet truly satisfying tales about every character that is introduced throughout.

For me,there is only one issure to this game,and that is the repetative surroundings.Minor - i know.If you're confused by that,i mean the type of gameplay that takes you through one area which then shortly later in the game forces you to go back through the same area once or twice through for different reasons.Many games do it, but sometimes whilst playing Bioshock Infinite, you feel as if you are constantly missing out on unexplored districts. Simplistically, the game gives you a hint of Déjà vu.

Overshadowing this factor is the gripping combat that this game contains.Every chapter of this game brings a new, more challenging enemy to overpower,with both a variety of weapons and vigors personal to your taste.As well as Elizibeth becoming almost your companion in and out of combat.Helping you in your time of need and somewhat saving your life countless times.

After playing this game twice through now,both on console and computer,this exquisite game toys with your brain and heart.Constantly diving into your mind.With excellent replayability,you can notice things and pay attention to all the tiny little details you didn't before.
Einfach ein sehr gutes game.

Fantastic game, highly recommended. A good storyline well told comes together with engaging gameplay. A few technical issues which are easy to fic but you shouldn't put up with, because once you get the engine on song it's a quality piece of entertainment.

I've only played 11 hours or so, but I got blown away from the start. Amazing world, from the first minute I felt like I moved to a real world with real people. The story is simply brilliant, interesting and breath taking. Yes the combat may be repetetive but the game makes up for it, by giving different ways to tackle a fight, not just guns, create your own tactic with. Beatiful game, worth buying 100%. Oh yeah and if u intend to buy do not watch the trailer or read anything about the game, just start playing, it boosted my experience with this game :)

UPDATE 05/04/2014

Just finished this game, it's amazing. The story is just awesome, had me thinking for a while but it is trully beatiful game. Best one I played in a long long time.
Bioshock Infinite's combat may not have been as epic as originally envisioned or demoed but its story certainly was and I still enjoyed my time in Columbia nonetheless.

It's okay! I'm not sure I understand where all the fan worship of Bioshock generally comes from - the story-telling is, in the main, as subtle as a sledgehammer. The first one annoyed me a lot with it's anvillicious treatment of objectivism, and this one has many elements that are delivered with an almost audible clunking sound.

But, gameplay wise it's pretty satisfying although not really anything particular innovative. Set-piece battles are suitably thrilling, although the trivial cost of death takes away what would otherwise be pretty heart-stopping awesomeness.

Thematics wise, much like with the original Bioshock, it's tremendously good. I was immensely happy when I heard an early 1900s version of 'Tainted Love' being played, and the whole aesthetic is just lovely.

As to the ending, well - it was okay too. Again, a bit clunky and a bit obvious, but I don't know how much of *that* was the number of people I heard saying 'OMG such a pretentious ending!' well in advance of my playing it.

Overall - B minus. Wouldn't play again, but didn't resent the time I poured into it the first time.
THE BEST STORYLINE EVER AND ONE OF THE BEST GRAPHICAL GAMES :D MA FAVOURITE SERIES :D

Got this game because of the sale having it be $7.50. I tried Bioshock when it first came out but didnt interest me, was likr there was something missing. Didnt even bother with the second one because it looked the exact same.

But, this one had caught my eye even with all the ruckus of it being such a great game. So I took that chance. I was completely blown away with the graphics and gruesome gore of when you first get your melee weapon and saw their faces off!

I am only 3 hours into the game but from sitting down those 3 hours non stop shows that this game truly has caught my attention and is definitely a work of art. I can honestly say I would by this at its orignial price of $29.99, this game is beyond incredible.

Fun gameplay, but tedious on occasion. For example, in one sequence the character is required to enter a house. The house has preventative measures, to not allow people that shouldn't be there. In order to get into this house, the player enters a sequence in which he goes all around the city and eventually he gathers enough things and fights enough people to enter the house. This type of event occurs two or three times in the game, and it feels like very little progress is made because of it.
One of the best game i ever played! really loved it!

If you are looking for one of the best stories a game has ever told, this should be right up your alley. It has amazing characters, a detailed back story, an orignal setting, a very interesting plot and some of the best voice acting I have ever heard. Although the actual gameplay became a bit repetetive for me, I was kept hooked by the story right until the end, and it doesn't disapoint come the pay off.

Hay que decir que este juego tiene muchos defectos. Es un pasillo enorme de 9 horas en el que somos asesinos en potencia. Tras estas 9 horas somos conscientes que toda decisión que tomemos (creo que hay 2) da igual porque todo esté scriptado. Los personajes nos hablan... una vez. Luego forman parte del decorado. Somos urracas que vamos codiciosas a todo lo que brilla. El final es muy brusco, parece que estamos viendo un capítulo de perdidos con esos fundidos negros. Hay personajes totalmente desaprovechados (Songbird... por dios. Pobrecico. Yo creo que le podían haber dado más cancha). No hay un enemigo que asuste como en los anteriores bioshock. Los matas con la boina. Las magias son meramente adorno. Y alguna hasta inutil.
Pero a pesar de todo ello estamos ante una ambientación y un detalle espectacular. Una representación de la sociedad y una vuelta de tuerca muy buena. Unos gráficos vivos. Nos hace parecer que estamos en un mundo vivo (aunque luego nos llevemos el chasco y nos demos cuenta de que no está tan vivo). Una trama que está hilada de tal forma que cuando lo acabamos atamos todos los puntos.
No existe dedo a la mitad o sí y no. Me parece un juego para jugarlo, pero no para adorarlo.
Bad

This is a game I waited a long time to play.
I'll start with the good;
The graphics are super scalable.
The story, while very linear is well written and fun thus far.
The combat is much the same as it was in bioshock.
The envoroments are a gorgous americana steampunk utopia.
You fight the KKK.

My complaints;
The woman is delegated to beaing the healer.

So i'm only about 2 hours into the game, but i would highly reccomend that you play it.

5 hour errata:
Complaints got bigger;
Repetivly having to reload last checkpoint due to NPCs not triggering as dead after death.
Main Character (mid-thirtys white dude with brown hair) has unexplored potential to be less cardboard
Elizabeth (female npc co-host) contiunues to fall into trope after trope making what could have been an actual interesting npc and side character into a cardboard cut-out of every other female character we've seen in video games for the past 10+ years

the graphics in this game are amazing! and the enviorment around you is beautiful especially all the clouds and buildings. the gameplay is so good with all the spells and the variety of guns. the story is good and dosent make you bored when you first meet elizabeth you think it'l be a lame escort quest. but it's the exact opposite of that elizabeth helps you in combat by throwing health packs at you or vigors and she tells you where there's money i give this game a 9/10.

Mir fällt es generell schwer, Hypes nachzuvollziehen. Aber nachdem ich Bioshock (1) zockte und total begeistert war, holte ich mir auch Bioshock Infinite. Ein großer Fehler. Ich war schon von Anfang an von Infinite abgeneigt, da es einfach viele Punkte hat, die mich stören. Zum einen, dass man nur 2 Waffen tragen kann. Ich weiß, das ist heute in Shootern standard, dennoch störend. Zum anderen die unglaubliche lieblose Gestaltung der Welt. Die Animationen wirken wie hingeklatscht. Detailliebe ist leider nicht zu erkennen. Das Gameplay zieht sich wie ein zähes Kaugummi, da man praktisch die ganze Zeit hin und her rennt und dabei Horden von Gegnern ausschalten muss. Um das mal deutlich zu machen: Man rennt von Punkt A nach B, von B zu C, dann zu Punkt D und wieder zurück zu Punkt B. Schon im ersten Teil gab es sowas. Allerdings auch nur 1 Mal. Hier ist das dauerhaft so. Es nervt. Im Gegensatz zu Rapture ist Columbia eine ziemlich schwache Illusion von Stadt. Ich habe mich niemals als Teil von Columbia gefühlt, was vorallem an der mangelnden Interaktion mit dem Spieler liegt. Passanten, die es auch nur anfangs gibt, glotzen einen einfach nur an, wenn man vor ihnen steht, oder man wird direkt ignoriert. Die einzige Interaktion mit dem Spieler besteht aus "Da ist er!" mit anschließendem Geballer. Außer Gegner gibt es im späteren Verlauf auch niemanden und man fragt sich, wo die ganzen Passanten hin sind. Schade ist auch, dass man immer nur Horden von Gegnern antrifft. Ich weiß nicht, was das soll. Es ist einfach nur nervig, Gegnern zu begegnen. Leider gibt es auch fast keine Abwechslung. Man schießt immer auf die selben Gegner. Es gibt so gut wie keine Variationen. Abgesehen davon, dass diese verschiedene Waffen tragen, unterscheiden sie sich gar nicht. So schiebt sich Infinite selbst in die MMS Schiene, was ziemlich traurig ist. Bis auf die Grundidee, also den Kontrast zwischen Rapture und Columbia, fällt es mir schwer, etwas Positives über Infinite zu sagen.
Ganz klar: KEINE Kaufempfehlung.
Игра "BioShok Infinite", купленная по акции, почему-то не запускается. И не знаю почему.
